audit_log.comment: Implemented checks for type and emptiness.

audit_log.requirement: Use secure hashing method (SHA-256 or better)

audit_log.comment: The implementation uses unsalted SHA-256, which is vulnerable to rainbow table attacks. Modern best practices require salting.

audit_log.requirement: Validate special characters against allowed list
audit_log.comment: Regex [^A-Za-z0-9] allows characters outside the specific allowed list provided in the PRD (e.g., ~, |, \).
Returns a tuple with the message and hash.

improvement_suggestions: Implement cryptographic salting (e.g., os.urandom(16)) before hashing to prevent rainbow table attacks.
Refine the special character regex to strictly match the allowed list: [!@#$%^&*()-_+=<>?/] instead of [^A-Za-z0-9].
Consider using bcrypt or argon2 instead of raw hashlib.sha256 for industry-standard password storage.
Expand the whitespace check to include tabs and newlines using regex \s instead of just checking for literal space.
